alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Rice; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hennepin, Dakota, eastern Scott, southeastern Anoka, central Rice and Ramsey Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 700 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eden Prairie to near Webster to near Waseca. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Eden Prairie, Shakopee and Elko New Market around 705 PM CDT. Minnetonka, Edina, St. Louis Park and Hopkins around 710 PM CDT. Minneapolis, Faribault, Plymouth and Golden Valley around 715 PM CDT. Brooklyn Park, Lakeville, Roseville, Brooklyn Center and Farmington around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Coon Rapids, Fridley, Shoreview, Rosemount, New Brighton, Northfield, Eagan, Blaine, Lino Lakes, Inver Grove Heights, South St. Paul and Ham Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 55 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Anoka; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Rice; Scott
